a-1.etymology: 感嘆意符 + 小寫拉丁字母 A；意符為沒有下面一點的感嘆號（!）。對照 o

a-2.commentary: This is likely not the earliest instance of this glyph, but there is no known earlier one.

akesi-1.etymology: 動物意符；蜥蜴的象形。意符表示眼睛

akesi-2.commentary: This glyph was created independently by many people. At the earliest, it appears in linja sike's first beta, but there it is not an independent glyph- it can only be accessed by stacking akesi with another glyph.

ala-1.etymology: X 記號，否定的跨語種符號

anpa-1.etymology: 位置意符 + 「容器」；後者疑似來自不完整正方形，表示一般物體（對照 sinpin）或容器（對照 poki）。關於意符，參見布利斯符號中小點的用法；對照布利斯符號「以下」

ante-1.etymology: 疑似為 sama 的形變，或者 sama 與 ala的結合。疑似為兩條線分叉的象形

anu-1.etymology: 疑似來自數學符號「邏輯或」（∨）

awen-1.etymology: 移動意符；雙足相對，意為站立

en-1.etymology: 來自加號（+）；對照布利斯符號「和」

epiku-1.commentary: The earlier version of this glyph by TheDarkBomber more closely resembles the design of Reddit's upvote, but that design was replaced by the thinner design.

esun-1.etymology: 並非來自貨幣符號（索尼婭確認：說過「它好像是來自克馬克 [Mikmaq] 的」，但未能找到與之相似的米克馬克符號）

ike-1.etymology: 傷心表情的象形。對照 pona

insa-1.etymology: 位置意符 + 「容器」；對照布利斯符號「裡面」

jami-1.commentary: This glyph went through a few revisions before this version created by jan Sa and lipamanka. For example: https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/301377942062366741/743016537845399562

jan-1.etymology: 頭部意符；人的肩膀的象形

jo-1.etymology: 疑似為人指著自己或拿著東西的象形

kala-2.commentary: The given earliest known glyph is somewhat silly, but it is an apt and intentional representation of the kala glyph with eyes.

kama-1.etymology: 移動意符；向左動的雙足。對照 tawa 和布利斯符號「步行」

kapesi-1.commentary: The earliest known version of this glyph has an overlapping triangle and circle. This is not considered a problem, as this minor variation is only distinguished by the various glyphs for olin.

ken-1.etymology: 疑似來自拉丁字母 K

kili-1.etymology: 水果（疑似為蘋果）的象形

kokosila-2.commentary: It is not currently known whether this glyph was created by jan Same or if it was taken from a prior reference.

kon-1.etymology: 指事；波浪線表示氣體的流動性。對照 telo

konwe-1.commentary: This glyph has been independently created a few times; the currently known earliest instance is likely not the earliest, especially based on the followin conversation: https://discord.com/channels/948448338662010910/1191946786936459325/1294891407026159647
konwe-1.etymology: 康威生命遊戲中滑翔機（能一直在遊戲版面上移動的機器）的象形

ku-1.etymology: 《道本語詞典》封面的象形，顯示一件有道本語刺繡的夾克

kule-1.etymology: 顏色意符；橫線疑似表示「本身概念」的意思，或者為光經過稜鏡的象形（顏色意符）

kulijo-1.commentary: jan Lepeka reports to have created the lete version of kulijo, but we have not found the source. https://discord.com/channels/948448338662010910/1191946786936459325/1294891407026159647

kulupu-1.etymology: 三個成員（以圓形表示）的群組的象形

kute-1.etymology: 耳朵的象形；對照布利斯符號「耳朵」

la-1.etymology: 疑似與布利斯符號「之後」或「以前」有關，或者疑似為括號

lanpan-2.commentary: The flipped pana version of lanpan is likely older than currently known.

lawa-1.etymology: 頭部意符；橫線疑似與 kule 的相同，或者疑似為人戴著帽子的象形

len-1.etymology: 疑似為一塊布料的象形

lili-1.etymology: 比 suli 小的指事符號

lipu-1.etymology: 一張紙的象形；對照布利斯符號「紙」

lon-1.etymology: 在一條線以上的位置意符；對照布利斯符號「上面」

lukin-1.etymology: 眼睛的象形；對照布利斯符號「眼睛」

ma-1.etymology: 疑似來自地球的現代天文符號（⊕）

mama-1.etymology: 頭部意符；較小的圓形疑似代表孩子

mani-1.etymology: 大型牲畜（比如牛）的象形（索尼婭確認）

meli-2.commentary: This glyph has been independently recreated several times. For example, it was added to ijo Mina's linja suwi as 'meli-alt' in February 2021. https://web.archive.org/web/20210211124101/https://linjasuwi.ap5.dev/

melome-1.commentary: lipamanka reports to have created this glyph to avoid it looking like 'nena+olin'

meso-2.commentary: this glyph has also been tokana and yupekosi before.... https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/301377942062366741/743016537845399562 08/12/2020 by Elemenopi https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/340307145373253642/804188957712973844 here as tokana but it's sideways --- so, the history here is weird- olipija was already using this glyph as meso before lipamanka/jan Sa suggested it to be tokana! the yupekosi one seems to be unrelated.

mi-1.etymology: 疑似為指著說話者的手。對照 sina 和 ona

mije-1.etymology: 頭部意符 + 寬肩膀（疑似）。對照 jan

mije-2.commentary: This glyph has been independently recreated several times. For example, it was added to ijo Mina's linja suwi as 'mije-alt' in February 2021. https://web.archive.org/web/20210211124101/https://linjasuwi.ap5.dev/

moli-1.etymology: 頭部意符；叉號雙眼，代表死者

monsi-1.etymology: 位置意符 + 旋轉的「容器」。對照 sinpin

mulapisu-1.commentary: The directionality of the pizza is not a distinguishing factor.

mun-1.etymology: 新月的象形；對照布利斯符號「月亮」

musi-1.etymology: 疑似為紅潤臉龐或豎琴的象形

mute-1.etymology: 三條記數直線。對照 wan 和 tu

mute-2.commentary: This was created as a ligature in Nishiki Teki on 11-02-2022, but not acknowledged as a "mute" glyph until Sonja posted it on 01-01-2024 and explicitly called such on 01-17-2024.

n-1.etymology: 感嘆意符 + 小寫字母「n」

nanpa-1.etymology: 來自井號（#）。對照布利斯符號「數字」

nasa-1.etymology: 疑似為表示眩暈的螺旋形（如日本動漫所見）

nasin-1.etymology: 沿著直線的箭頭的指事

ni-2.commentary: The original source is an ASCII rendering of the glyph, and referenced as "eni".  The contraction "eni" was only used a few dozen times in total, but the right-arrow rendering of ni remained and was added to linja sike 5 on 2021-08-31.

ni-5.commentary: It is likely that left ni was derived earlier, as the idea of 'ni' pointing any direction has developed independently several times. Some mentions of seeing them sooner exist, such as here: https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/876636350214979614/928536305028169769

ni-6.commentary: Although the source of the glyph references it as 'epiku', it also references it as 'turned ni'.

nimi-1.etymology: 疑似為命名牌或 sitelen pona 名字框的象形

o-1.etymology: 感嘆意符 + 小寫拉丁字母 O。對照 a

olin-1.etymology: 兩個心形（♡），疑似為區分此單詞和 pilin

olin-2.etymology: two heart symbols (♡), perhaps to distinguish from pilin.

ona-1.etymology: 疑似為指著旁邊的手。對照 mi 和 sina

pi-1.etymology: 疑似為布利斯符號「被、由」

pika-1.commentary: The earliest known instance of this glyph is by nimi Elemenopi, but it was called linluwi and not pika. It is not known where this glyph came to be called pika, but it is believed that this glyph developed independently from other abstract representations of electricity. https://www.reddit.com/r/tokipona/comments/hxzvew

pilin-1.etymology: 來自心形（♡）。對照布利斯符號「感覺」

pimeja-1.etymology: 顏色衣服；叉號疑似表示沒有光

pona-1.etymology: 微笑表情的象形。對照 ike

pu-1.etymology: 《道本語：好的語言》封面的象形，抑或 lipu 和 toki pona 的複合字形

sama-1.etymology: 來自等號（=）；對照布利斯符號「相同」

san-1.commentary: This glyph for san may have been developed independently multiple times.

seli-1.etymology: 疑似為點燃營火的象形或者火的簡化象形

seme-1.etymology: 來自問號（?）；對照布利斯符號「什麼」

sike-1.etymology: 兩個圓形（疑似為區分此單詞和 ijo），抑或粗空心圓形的輪廓

sina-1.etymology: 疑似為指著聽者手。對照 mi 和 ona

sinpin-1.etymology: 位置意符 + 旋轉的「容器」。對照 monsi

sitelen-1.etymology: 疑似為畫著符號的紙張（lipu）的象形

soko-1.commentary: Despite thin stem soko being the more popular rendering of soko through at least February 2024, the primary glyph for soko is annulus soko as determined by the Unicode project.

soko-3.commentary: Despite thin stem soko being the more popular rendering of soko through at least February 2024, the primary glyph for soko is annulus soko as determined by the Unicode project.

soweli-1.etymology: 動物意符；哺乳動物的象形

su-1.etymology: 《綠野仙蹤》圖書的封面的象形，包含故事中的黃磚路

suli-1.etymology: 比 lili 大的指事符號

supa-1.etymology: 桌子的象形；對照布利斯符號「桌子」

tan-1.etymology: 向左指的彎曲箭頭，表示衍生或成因

tawa-1.etymology: 移動意符；向右動的雙足。對照 kama 和布利斯符號「步行」

telo-1.etymology: 波浪的象形；對照布利斯符號「水」

tenpo-1.etymology: 時鐘的象形；對照布利斯符號「時間」

toki-1.etymology: 射線符號 + ijo 或一般圓形

tomo-1.etymology: 屋子的象形；對照布利斯符號「屋子」

tu-1.etymology: 兩條記數直線。對照 mute 和 wan

unpa-1.etymology: 疑似為心形的衍生（此字形的原繪圖特別明顯），或者表示性交的結，或疑似為生殖器官的象形

usawi-1.commentary: The glyph 'nasa with emitters' was created on 2020-03-24 by jan Tumu, but the glyph would not be called usawi until independently created by jan Seli in 2021. https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/375591429608570881/692078503151009892

uta-2.commentary: jan Misali's "sitelen pona tan pu" font from 2016-09-06 depicts dotless uta. However, it is not considered the source of dotless uta today, as the font was and is essentially unknown, having only 11 downloads as of March 2025. Access the font here: https://fontstruct.com/fontstructions/show/1315854/sitelen-pona-tan-pu

utala-1.etymology: 疑似來自交錯的劍符號（⚔️）

walo-1.etymology: 顏色意符；疑似為 pimeha 的相反，其中顏色意符在叉號之上，而非之下

wan-1.etymology: 一個記數直線或阿拉伯數字 1，疑似為加強可區分性

wawa-1.etymology: 疑似為人舉起雙手（表示強壯）的象形

weka-1.etymology: 「消失線」，表示某東西消失的動作

wile-1.etymology: 疑似來自拉丁字母 W
